channel.title: Whonix gateway freezing
channel.description:
i have faced gw in kvm fresh installing freezing , whonix 11. and i think i know how to reproduce it.
after installing the gw and the ws (by just making them appeared inside the kvm) , open the gw and keep it open till it finish the installation then make apt-get update and apt-get upgrade. (all that without opening the ws)
now open the ws then wait till it finish. then make sudo apt-get update, then go to the gw = nothing is moving and it cant be shutdown except by "force shutdown".
it is not persistent tho , after the shutdown both of them. they gonna start after that working normally.

no, Whonix doesn’t depend in KDE for anything.

Have a nice day,

Read full topic

item.title: Whonix gateway freezing
item.dc:creator: exacto
item.description:
Since switching DE I haven’t had any crashes (or clipboard problems) either.

I will stop reporting on this issue because the new DE works well enough and was painless to install on the Workstation, and I’m done trying to hunt down the original cause. It has to be one or more of QXL, spice or CPU causing crashing. The clipboard bug has to be spice.

There are some rough edges, such as the desktop icons are not marked as executable which new DE complains about, but nothing major. I was afraid there were whonix parts that depend on KDE but I don’t see anything missing. (Please advise if I’m wrong)

Read full topic

item.title: Whonix gateway freezing
item.dc:creator: anonymityISright
item.description:
28 days of usage without freezing’s! and again the settings\configuration that i understand is the reason for success:

fedora 21 i686 xfce4 host with lxdm , (updates & upgrades done on host and guests) , parcellite clipboard manager on host and guests (the default clipboard managers are killed and disabled for autostart,) some times failed for autostart the parcellite on kde’s but that is not problem , can just start it and is ready on seconds.

  • xml is edited for clipboard sharing right by the directions on whonix-kvm documentation.
    not touch any other settings on virt-manager \xml’s

*I am sorry , i use ver, 11. not 12, so my posts here are for whonix ver. 11.
I am stop the posts here , (28 days without freezings). At curent level , the download option for whonix images is ver. 12, if they have freezings to , can aply the workaround in that post.

Read full topic

item.title: Whonix gateway freezing
item.dc:creator: exacto
item.description:
Another possible factor I forgot about is the CPU. Whonix is the only VM I still use which is 32-bit. And on other machines I’ve occasionally run into problems with the default hypervisor processor though I don’t remember if I tried different settings against these KDE crashes. For example Tails had a known crash against default qemu processor, requiring the “Copy Host CPU configuration” setting be set.

There are too many variables.

Read full topic

item.title: Whonix gateway freezing
item.dc:creator: exacto
item.description:
I attempted to use a different DE than KDE on the official Whonix Workstation and thus far it works better. The copy-pasting spice issue I complain about only seems to happen in KDE. It hasn’t crashed yet either. I suspect KDE triggers latent issues in QXL or spice.

Read full topic

item.title: Whonix gateway freezing
item.dc:creator: anonymityISright
item.description:
This is a confirmation for 6 days of usage without freezing’s at all , and again my settings:

fedora 21 i686 xfce4 host with lxdm ,pae kernel, (updates & upgrades done on host and guests) , parcellite clipboard manager on host and guests (the default clipboard managers are killed and disabled for autostart,) some times failed for autostart the parcellite on kde’s but that is not problem , can just start it and is ready on seconds.

  • i have a total system 8 GB ram and i give to each guest 1536 MB, not touch any other settings on virt-manager \xml’s

Read full topic

item.title: Whonix gateway freezing
item.dc:creator: exacto
item.description:
There is another issue you should know about I don’t see documented: QXL does not always play nice with kernel modesetting.

On some systems you have to add
qxl.modeset=0
to the kernel command line in
/etc/default/grub
and run
update-grub

It made no difference for this crashing but helps fix some other problems, worth a try.

Read full topic

item.title: Whonix gateway freezing
item.dc:creator: exacto
item.description:
I saw this topic but was not sure it was the same issue because the crash kills processes and causes data loss.

I use 2-4 gigabyte RAM for the workstation. QXL gets 64 megabyte (as soon as you change any setting libvirt/virtmanager goes back to 64), but tried more manually in xml.

My impression was that it was Spice, QXL or KDE (or KDE reacting badly to QXL). Debian Jessie’s QXL driver is strange and I have had issues with it in other guests, but nowhere near as bad as this with KDE. The only other OS I have seen similar problems with QXL is Mageia, but I can’t figure out what they have in common. It may be unrelated to this but it’s to say Jessie is has problems. I also notice the spice copy pasting correlates more or less with KDE exploding.

I felt that simpler DE would lessen chance of issues, because I’ve never had it this bad.

Read full topic

item.title: Whonix gateway freezing
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
@exacto For now there is no basis to conclude that it’s caused by KDE. Since this is only happening in KVM and not in other platforms such as Whonix VirtualBox or Qubes-Whonix, it’s more likely a KVM rather than KDE issue.

Read full topic

item.title: Whonix gateway freezing
item.dc:creator: exacto
item.description:
Hello, am repeat user.

Whonix-Workstation with KDE on qemu/kvm crashes randomly but regularly on average twice every 12 hours. It logs out and kills all DE processes, losing all data.

I have experienced this on 2 different hosts ever since Debian Jessie, for months on end, and a workstation reinstall.

In addition, copy-pasting from host to guest (with spice) at random times will fail and completely lock up the KDE window of the target program. It often but not always comes before a full KDE crash.

I added the qxl surfaces hack.

I have never experienced this with any other guest OS/Desktop environment. Only Whonix with KDE.

I normally don’t complain about choice of DE but in this case it is so bad that the workstation is unusable for any serious purpose. I am writing this is Kwrite and saving every 5 seconds because I am afraid it will crash any moment.

I know it’s the author’s choice but I feel after this prolonged experience with KDE in a VM that a lightweight desktop such as LXDE or XFCE would be infinitely more appropriate (I am not a fan of the Qubes’s project choices either), though I am not a fan of any DE.

I would settle for a fix to this crashing if someone knows of one. I will have no choice but to make a custom workstation which I would rather not. Normally I prefer to adapt to whatever’s given. It takes a lot to get me to this point…

Read full topic

item.title: Whonix gateway freezing
item.dc:creator: anonymityISright
item.description:
I mean are have Patrick and HulaHoop the needed knowledge for reporting , i dont know how to logs upstream , i allready solve the freezings referenced on this topic ,
successfuly run it stable for 5 days and without issues with:

fedora 21 i686 xfce4 host with lxdm ,pae kernel, (updates & upgrades done on host and guests) , and with parcellite clipboard manager on host and guests (the default clipboard managers are killed and disabled for autostart,) some times failed for autostart the parcellite on kde’s but that is not problem , can just start it and is ready on seconds.

If that have matter i have full disk luks on host.

What cause the freezings on virt-manager :

any other desktop environment exept xfce4 on host, any other display manager exept lxdm on host,
any other clipboard manager on host and guests exept parcellite .
I dont know if is responsible the debian , i have not time to test it .
also i have not time for learning logs upstream i am sorry , i hope to help with that posts here.

Read full topic
